Envs Package¶

l2r.envs.env¶

class l2r.envs.env.RacingEnv(max_timesteps, controller_kwargs, reward_kwargs, action_if_kwargs, pose_if_kwargs, cameras, obs_delay=0.1, reward_pol='default', training=True, not_moving_timeout=20, provide_waypoints=False)[source]¶

Bases: gym.core.Env

A reinforcement learning environment for autonomous racing. Certain features, including segmentation images, ground-truth waypoints, or birdseye cameras are not realistically accessible and should not be used in evalution.

Parameters

  • max_timesteps (int) – maximimum number of timesteps per episode

  • controller_kwargs (dict) – keyword args for the simulator controller

  • reward_kwargs (dict) – keyword args the reward policy

  • action_if_kwargs (dict) – keyword args for the action interface

  • pose_if_kwargs (dict) – keyword args for the position receive interface

  • cameras (dict) – dictionary of camera keyword arguments

  • obs_delay (float) – time delay between action and observation

  • reward_pol (str) – reward policy to use, defaults to GranTurismo

  • training (bool) – in training mode, vehicle starts episodes at random positions on the track

  • not_moving_timeout (int) – terminate if not moving for this many timesteps

  • provide_waypoints (bool) – flag to provide ground-truth, future waypoints on the track in the info returned from step()

eval()[source]¶

If evaluation mode, do not use random start location.

make(level, multimodal, driver_params, vehicle_params=None, sensors=None, multi_agent=False, remake=False)[source]¶

Unlike many environments, make does not start the simulator process. It does, however, configure the simulator’s settings. The simulator process must be running prior to calling this method otherwise an error will occur when trying to establish a connection with the simulator.

Parameters

  • level (str) – the desired racetrack map in [‘VegasNorthRoad’, ‘Thruxton’, ‘AngleseyNational’]

  • multimodal (bool) – if false, then the agent is ‘visual only’ and only receives image data, if true, the agent also has access to positional sensor data

  • driver_params (dict) – driver parameters to modify

  • vehicle_params (dict) – vehicle parameters to set

  • sensors (list) – sensors to enable

  • multi_agent – not currently supported

  • remake (bool) – if remaking, reset the camera interfaces

property multimodal¶

Getter method for the multimodal property. Changing this value will cause the environment’s observation space to include the positional sensor data in the observation.

Returns

true if the environment is set to multimodal, false otherwise

Return type

bool

random_start_location()[source]¶

Randomly selects an index on the centerline of the track and returns the ENU coordinates of the selected index along with the yaw of the centerline at that point.

Returns

coordinates of a random index on centerline, yaw

Return type

np array, float

render()[source]¶

Not implmeneted. The simulator, by default, provides a graphical interface, but can also be run on a server.

reset(level=False, random_pos=True)[source]¶

Resets the vehicle to start position. A small time delay is used allow for the simulator to reset.

Parameters

  • level (str) – if specified, will set the simulator to this level, otherwise set to a random track

  • random_pos (bool) – true/false for random starting position on the track

Returns

an intial observation as in the step method

Return type

see step() method

step(action)[source]¶

The primary method of the environment. Executes the desired action, receives the observation from the simulator, and evaluates termination conditions. The returned observation is a tuple with the observation and a racetrack identifier.

Parameters

action (array-like) – the action and acceleration requests

Returns

observation, reward, done, info

Return type

if multimodal, the observation is a tuple containing the positional sensor data and a dictionary of images with shapes (30,) and (height, width, 3), respectively, otherwise the observation is just the dictionary of images. reward is of type float, done bool, and info dict

train()[source]¶

Use random starting locations on the track

l2r.envs.reward¶

class l2r.envs.reward.GranTurismo(oob_penalty=5.0, min_oob_penalty=25.0)[source]¶

Bases: core.templates.AbstractReward

This is the default reward for the environment. It is our interpretation of the work: Super-Human Performance in Gran Turismo Sport Using Deep Reinforcement Learning (https://arxiv.org/abs/2008.07971). Rewarding the agent only for completing a lap is too sparse for learning. Instead, this is a dense reward function that rewards the agent for progressing down the track and penalizes the agent for going out-of-bounds.

Parameters

  • oob_penalty (float) – penalty factor for going out-of-bounds where the total penalty is this factor times the velocity of the vehicle

  • min_oob_penalty (float) – minimum penalty for going out-of-bounds

get_reward(state, oob_flag=False)[source]¶

The reward for the given state is the sum of its progress reward and the penalty for going out-of-bounds.

Parameters

  • state (varies) – the current state of the environment

  • oob_flag (boolean, optional) – true if out-of-bounds, otherwise false

reset()[source]¶

Reset cached index representing the position on the track.

l2r.envs.utils¶

class l2r.envs.utils.ActionInterface(ip='', port=7077, max_steer=1.0, min_steer=- 1.0, max_accel=6.0, min_accel=- 16.0)[source]¶

Bases: object

Action send interface. This class communicates with the simulator and sends action requests from the agent.

Parameters

  • ip (str) – ip address

  • port (int) – port to bind to

  • max_steer (float) – maximum steering request, bounded by 1.

  • min_steer (float) – minimum steering request, bounded by -1.

  • max_accel (flaot) – maximum acceleration request, bounded by 6.

  • min_accel (float) – minimum acceleration request, bounded by -16.

act(action)[source]¶

Send action request to the simulator.

Parameters

action (array-like) – action to send to the simulator in the form: [steering, acceleration], expected to be in the range (-1., 1.)

static get_corners(center, angle, dimensions)[source]¶

Get the corner’s of the vehicle. Assumes the vehicle is perfectly rectangular.

Parameters

  • center (tuple) – the (x,y) coordinates of the center of the vehicle

  • angle (float) – heading of the vehicle in radians

  • dimensions (list) – [height, width] of the vehicle in meters

Returns

array of (x,y) coordinates in the following order: Top_right, Top_left, Bottom_right, Bottom_left

Return type

numpy.array

exception l2r.envs.utils.InvalidActionException[source]¶

Bases: Exception

class l2r.envs.utils.PoseInterface(ip='', port=7078, data_elems=30)[source]¶

Bases: core.templates.AbstractInterface

Receives sensor data from the simulator. The data received is in the following format:

[0,1,2] steering, gear, mode

[3,4,5] velocity

[6,7,8] acceleration

[9,10,11] angular velocity

[12,13,14] yaw, pitch, roll

[15,16,17] location coordinates in the format (y, x, z)

[18,19,20 21] rpm (by wheel)

[22,23,24,25] brake (by wheel)

[26,27,28,29] torq (by wheel)

Parameters

  • ip (str) – ip address

  • port (int) – port to bind to

  • data_elems (int) – number of elements to listen for, elements are assumed to be of type float

get_data()[source]¶

Return the most recent data received from the simulator.

Returns

data from the simulator

Return type

array of length self.data_elems

reset()[source]¶

Allocates memory for data receive.

start()[source]¶

Starts a thread to listen for data from the simulator.
